RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Ndal/UseDisplayExtensionForTonOutExt
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies whether to present the subscriber Display extension for DNM extension output rules

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Xdm/MaxEndpointDevices
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies the maximum number of device hosts per endpoint in SIP registrations (for keysets only).

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Xdm/MaxRegistrationRenewal
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies the maximum time allowed for an Endpoint in RENEWED state.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Xdm/Registrar/EnableMultiPrimary
RtpParameter.Description: This flag enables or disables multi primary keyset registrations. If enabled the same DN will be allowed to register as a primary to different devices.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Xdm/SupportUnreachableState
RtpParameter.Description: Indicates whether unreachable state is allowed for subscriber endpoint.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Dlp/EnumTranslationOnAllCalls
RtpParameter.Description: Office parameter for the ENUM Translation on All calls. This parameter is used by XLA to determine whether to route all offnet call (calls terminating outside HiPath8K) to ENUM server. Note: This parameter is read by XDM and then communicated to XLA.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Xla/rateAreaCosBasedLongestMatch
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter decides the XLA digits matching algorithm in the destination code (e164Code) table: If the value of Srx/Xla/rateAreaCosBasedLongestMatch customer is true, then XLA matches the four tuple <digits, NOA, rateArea, Cos> as it traverses the digit tree. Otherwise, the XLA first macthes the two tuple <digits, NOA> at the node level as it traverses the digits tree, and then matches <rateAra, Cos> among the entries found at that node level.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Xla/ConvertIntlToGnf
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter is used to decide whether to convert the called party number into GNF format by adding '+' in the beginning of the DN and then continuing with the translating the GNF number (FRN4375)

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/DB/IsTimeZoneGMTLinuxDefault
RtpParameter.Description: The RTP parameter indicates whether to use the defeult POSIX-style signs in the Zone names and the output abbreviations. POSIX has positive signs west of Greenwich, but many people expect positive signs east of Greenwich. For example, TZ=Etc/GMT+4 uses the abbreviation GMT+4 and corresponds to 4 hours behind UTC even though many people would expect it to mean 4 hours ahead of UTC

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/DB/DBSizeWarningThreshold
RtpParameter.Description: The RTP parameter indicates whether an Warning alarm will be raised if the database file size will exceed that threshold, in terms of percentage regarding the maximum allowed database file size as it has been defined in solid.ini file

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/DB/DBSizeMajorThreshold
RtpParameter.Description: The RTP parameter indicates whether an Major alarm will be raised if the database file size will exceed that threshold, in terms of percentage regarding the maximum allowed database file size as it has been defined in solid.ini file

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/DB/DBSizeCriticalThreshold
RtpParameter.Description: The RTP parameter indicates whether an Critical alarm will be raised if the database file size will exceed that threshold, in terms of percentage regarding the maximum allowed database file size as it has been defined in solid.ini file

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/DB/DBSizeWarningAlarmControl
RtpParameter.Description: The RTP parameter indicates whether an Warning alarm will be raised if the database file size will exceed the Srx/DB/DBSizeWarningThreshold

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/DB/DBPmonRecordInterval
RtpParameter.Description: The RTP parameter indicates the frequency of pmon record capture exceed the Srx/DB/DBPmonRecordInterval

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/CDM/ControlTimer
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the granularity of certificate expiration checks in minutes

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/CDM/CECWarningTimeOfDay
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the time of day at which to perform a certificate expiration check.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/CDM/CECWarningPeriod
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the period ahead of the actual expiration for which a pending certificate expiration warning is issued. Setting it to 0 will actually simply set the certificate in the Removed (0) status upon expiration.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/CDM/CECWarningInterval
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the interval after the first certificate expiration warning with which the certificate expiration warning will be renewed. Setting it to 0 will deactivate reissuing the warning.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/CDM/CertificateStore
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the path to a directory that contains PEM files or a specific PEM file.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/CDM/CRLStore
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the path to a directory that contains downloaded CRLs.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/CDM/CRLUpdateInterval
RtpParameter.Description: Interval at which to download a new CRL. A value of 0 means that CRLs are updated only when the Next Update expires on the downloaded CRL.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/CDM/CRLShortUpdateInterval
RtpParameter.Description: Interval at which to download a CRL for which the previous download failed due to network or CRL server problems.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/CDM/CRLUpdateTimeOfDay
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the time of day at which to perform a CRL download.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/CDM/SuppressAlarm
RtpParameter.Description: Defines if Alarms are suppressed.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/CDM/PublicCertificateStore
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the path to a directory that contains PEM files for public certificates

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/CDM/CertificateKeyStore
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the path to a directory that contains PEM files for private certificates

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/ProtocolVersion
RtpParameter.Description: SIP Protocol Version, always set to 2.0

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/MimeVersion
RtpParameter.Description: The SIP MIME Version being used by the system.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/IpPort
RtpParameter.Description: Default port that sipsm listens to

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/IpPortTLS
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter is used in REGISTRAR and is the TLS port number used between TTUD and SIP REGISTRAR. When this parameter is changed Registrar must re-register with TTUD depending on the change. If the change is not the default port (5061) then Registrar send new TTUD REGISTER msg to TTUD with the new port . If the change is the default then Registrar send new TTUD UNREGISTER with old port. If the change indicate that neither the old port nor the new port is the default then Registrar must send new TTUD UNREGISTER with old port, then send send new TTUD REGISTER with new port.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/IpPortMTLS
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3601 - Flexible Ethernet and IP When the OSV is installed with the same IP address for SIP(UDP/TCP/TLS) and for SIP(MTLS), then non-standard port 5161 has to be used. All SIP endpoints that are to be connected via MTLS have to use this non-standard TCP/IP port when connecting to the OSV. Default value for this non-standard port shall be 5161.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/Timer_T1
RtpParameter.Description: T1 timer value is the base SIP retransmit timer interval (based on round trip time estimate). SIP request retransmission starts at T1 timer interval and doubles after every retransmission until the interval hits Timer T2 after which the retransmission occurs every T2 secs. T1 is an RFC defined timer used for retransmission of requests for unreliable transports (such as UDP). Please see section 17.1.1.1 in RFC3261 for further details.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/Timer_T2
RtpParameter.Description: The maximum retransmit interval. SIP request retransmission starts at T1 timer interval and doubles after every retransmission until the interval hits Timer T2, after which the retransmission occurs every T2 secs. Please see section 17.1.2.2 in RFC3261 for further details.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/Timer_T4
RtpParameter.Description: Maximum time that a SIP message will remain in the network. T4 timer value is based on the amount of time the network will take to clear messages between client and server transactions. Please see section 17.1.2.2 in RFC3261 for further details.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/Timer_OCS
RtpParameter.Description: Outgoing Call Supervision Timer: The maximum time that the OSV will wait for a provisional (except 100 Trying) or final response from a SIP subscriber or SIP endpoint, after sending a dialog-initiating INVITE to the subscriber/endpoint. If no response is received in this amount of time, the OSV will abandon the call. A value of 0 for this parameter means that this timing will not be applied to any calls.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/Timer_PBS
RtpParameter.Description: Proxy Bypass Supervision Timer: The maximum time that the OSV will wait for a provisional or final response from a SIP subscriber/endpoint, after sending a dialog-initiating INVITE to the subscriber/endpoint via a SIP proxy. If no response is received in this amount of time, the OSV will attempt to reroute the call by bypassing the proxy. A value of 0 for this parameter means that this timing will not be applied to any calls.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/Timer_AS
RtpParameter.Description: Audit Supervision Timer: The maximum time that the OSV will wait for a response from a SIP subscriber/endpoint, after sending OPTIONS to the subscriber/endpoint. If no response is received in this amount of time, the OSV will trigger current handling for unsuccessful audit to a SIP subscriber/endpoint.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/HungupTimer
RtpParameter.Description: Guard timer to release SIP call context after a call is released.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/ReleaseAckTimer
RtpParameter.Description: Internally used by SIPSM as a timer for UCE to respond to a Release message with a ReleaseAck

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/Session_Timer
RtpParameter.Description: Session Timer. If Srx/Sip/Session_Timer flag is set to YES, SIP session timer is enabled. ENABLED = YES DISABLED= NO

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/Min_Session_Timer_Value
RtpParameter.Description: Minimum value that SIP SM will accept. If inbound INVITE has Session-Expire time value less the configured Min_Session_Timer_Value, the request is rejected with 422. Srx/Sip/Session_Timer has to set to YES for this value to take effect.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/Reduced_Session_Timer_Value
RtpParameter.Description: The OpenScape Voice supports the Srx/Sip/Min_Session_Timer_Value which controls the minimum session timer accepted by the OpenScape Voice. There are scenarios need a smaller session timer, and this parameter is served for that purpose. This value is used as the mininum session timer value for calls from/to a SIP subscriber or endpoint which has the "Disable Long Call Audit" endpoint attribute set. Srx/Sip/Session_Timer has to set to YES for this value to take effect.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/UpdateMethodSessionTimingEnable
RtpParameter.Description: This RTP parm allows the enable or disable the use of SIP UPDATE request in a periodic refresh of SIP sessions. It has a default value of RtpFalse, enabling the use of SIP INVITE request in a periodic session refresh. If the parm is set to RtpTrue, SIP UPDATE request is used in session refresh. Srx/Sip/Session_Timer has to set to YES for this value to take effect.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/Min_Expires_Publish
RtpParameter.Description: Minimum value for incoming PUBLISH "expires" for publish event package

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/Min_Expires_Dialog
RtpParameter.Description: Minimum value for incoming SUBSCRIBE "expires" for dialog event package used for randomization of expires time

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/Min_Expires_Keyset
RtpParameter.Description: Minimum value for incoming SUBSCRIBE "expires" for keyset-info event package used for randomization of expires time

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/Min_Expires_Toggle
RtpParameter.Description: Minimum value for incoming SUBSCRIBE "expires" for keyset-toggle event package used for randomization of expires time

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/ReroutingSubscriberEnabled
RtpParameter.Description: Implemented for FRN0653. Stores the information if rerouting is active for subscribers Boolean is stored in sipControl if rerouting is active for subscribers. False = Rerouting disabled for SIP subscribers. True = Rerouting enabled for SIP subscribers.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/ResponseCodeForCauseValue18
RtpParameter.Description: Response Code for Cause Value 18 The default Respose Code for Cause Code 18 is 408, which can cause unintended reroutes in the destination. SIPQ returns a cause code 18 when the Subscriber is unregistered. In these cases the customer may want the 18, 'No User responding', to translate to 480 'Temporarily Unavailable' or 410 'Gone', to prevent the rerouting.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/SubscriberReroutingPAC
RtpParameter.Description: FRN2025 - Reroute for CAC Restriction or WAN Outage (prefix these digits to destination DN) ( THIS PARAMETER IS USED BY UCE )

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/AuthEnabled
RtpParameter.Description: Flag to enable or disable Digest Authentication

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/AuthServerQopOptions
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter is used to indicate the server "quality of protection" for Digest Authentication. auth = 0x01, auth-int = 0x02, auth-ext-int = 0x04, auth-hdr-int = 0x08 The values may be combined to apply multiple qop values (e.g. auth & auth-hdr-int = 0x01 & 0x08 = 0x09)

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/AuthClientQopPreference
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter is used to indicate the client preference of "quality of protection" to be applied for Digest Authentication. The valid values are auth = 0x01 and auth-int = 0x02

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/AuthNonceLifetime
RtpParameter.Description: The lifetime in milliseconds of a nonce used for Digest Authentication in order to limit the time of a nonce's validity for security purposes.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/AuthTraverseViaHdrs
RtpParameter.Description: Flag to enable authorization credentials to be looked up by traversing a requests Via headers. This functionality is by default disabled and was added as a precautionary feature in case backward compatability issues were encountered.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/AuthMaxAttempts
RtpParameter.Description: Maximum number of times a client may attempt to pass Digest Authentication validation before being sent a 403 forbidden response.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/sipq_interworkCalledPartyNumber
RtpParameter.Description: SIPQ interwork called party number. Enable this parameter to force the 8k to interwork the called party number even in tandem mode RtpTrue - interwork called party number in tandem mode RtpFalse - Do NOT interwork called party number in tandem mode

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/sipq_applyDNMForTransit
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3594: This parameter controls whether the OpenScape Voice will apply Number Modifications to the numbers, except from Called Party IE, in the QSIG MIME for Transit SIP-Q calls. The number modification of the Called Party IE is controllable through the RTP parameter Srx/Sip/sipq_interworkCalledPartyNumber in transit SIP-Q calls. This parameter has two possible values: RtpFalse, RtpTrue RtpFalse: Indicates that the OpenScape Voice will NOT apply Number Modifications for SIP-Q Transit calls. This shall be the default value. RtpTrue : Indicates that the OpenScape Voice will apply Number Modifications for SIP-Q Transit calls.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/SipQMaxTransitCount
RtpParameter.Description: FRN4061:This parameter controls how OpenScape Voice will handle the QSIG SETUP message with Transit Counter IE in tandem scenarios. If the transit count field of the Transit Counter IE has a value that is greater than or equal to the maximum limit of transit PINX's (the value of this RTP parameter) through which the call may be routed, the call shall be stopped from further routing. The parameter has possible values in the range of 1 - 31, with default value equals to 5.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/sip_trans_active
RtpParameter.Description: To disable header & body transparency turn off sip_trans_active. ENABLED = 1 DISABLED= 0

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/header_trans
RtpParameter.Description: To enable/disable Header transparency

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/RandomizeSubscribeExpiration
RtpParameter.Description: Parameter to enable randomizing of expire times received in SUBSCRIBE messages. If no expire time is received the default will be used i.e., this parameter will have no effect. Otherwise, the expire time used will be a random time between the computed percent of the given expire time (or the system min if greater than the computed time) and the given expire time itself. If set to false, SIP won't randomize any expire times for the corresponding message. The computed percent is found using Srx/Sip/RandomizeExpirationPercent.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/RandomizeExpirationPercent
RtpParameter.Description: The percentage of randomization used in correlation with Srx/Sip/RandomizeSubscribeExpiration.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/BestEffortSRTP
RtpParameter.Description: FRN 2683 RtpFalse means feature is OFF, RtpTrue means feature is ON SEE BO2683

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/CpuCiscDurationTimer
RtpParameter.Description: FRN2853 - Nw CPU Cisc Call Duration: This parameter provides the duration of a SIPQ CISC session in case of a NW CPU Scenario.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/CentralSbcSupport
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3711 RtpTrue: 1- a chain of multiple Associated EPs is allowed. (see below for Srx/Main/MaxEPsInAssociationChain parm to define the depth of the chain) 2- EPs are recognized based on their IP:port. 3- Registration will verify the subscriber's associated EP based in IP:port. 4- support for NNI or GW behind Central-SBC. (Route header will be added to request. RtpFalse: -none of the above.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/BestEffortSRTPSDES
RtpParameter.Description: FRN 3890 This parameter turns ON/OFF the feature for Best Effort SRTP Support with SDES. RtpFalse means feature is OFF, RtpTrue means feature is ON. SEE BO2683

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/ANATSupport
RtpParameter.Description: FRN 3786 This parameter turns ON/OFF the ANAT Support feature. RtpFalse means feature is OFF, RtpTrue means feature is ON. SEE BO3786 CQ 166124 - Change default to False

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/KeysetHoldRecallAllLines
RtpParameter.Description: Parameter to define the handling of the Keyset Hold Recall. If parameter is: RtpTrue. Notify/recall sent to all keyset lines during hold recall. (default) RtpFalse. Only the device that placed the call on [manual] hold will receive the Notify/recall.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/DualPathFallbackToReuseAllowed
RtpParameter.Description: FRN4334 Parameter to define if fall back to Reuse Method is allowed. If parameter is: RtpTrue. Endpoints set to use Dual Path Method may fallback to Reuse Method in case an outgoing TLS connection cannot be made. (default) RtpFalse. Endpoints set to use Dual Path Method may NOT fallback to Reuse Method in case an outgoing TLS connection cannot be made.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/VerifyResponsibleDomains
RtpParameter.Description: FRN4938 - Domain Based Routing Specifies whether the OSV verifies if the maddr or hostport of a request URI matches one of the domain to which the OSV is responsible for routing calls If paramater is: RtpTrue: OSV verifies the maddr or hostport of Request URI matches one of the responsible domains before looking at the userinfo part of the Request URI. RtpFalse: Request URI host or maddr is not verified.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/ResponsibleDomains
RtpParameter.Description: FRN4938 - Domain Based Routing List of one or more (comma-separated) case-insensitive domain names that the OSV is responsible for routing calls to.
RtpParameter.Range: List of one or more domains (comma-separated)

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/ICEInterworkingFeature
RtpParameter.Description: ICE Interworking FRN6737 Used to turn on ICE feature OSV interworking of ICE lite attributes in the sdp.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/MtpCodecPriorityList
RtpParameter.Description: List of codecs in order of priority which must be used by OSV when creating dummy SDP Answer for Media Transfer Point (MTP) calls.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/WildcardedResponsibleDomains
RtpParameter.Description: Used to bypass the DNS query and bypass the sipsm cached FQDNs, as well as to reduce the heap cache for FQDN entries. Customer may use the OSV's FQDN for location information and CAC feature. Therefore there may be many FQDNs created to identify subscriber's location for example "010001.022208.osv02.pvg.sipprovider.us". DNS servers may setup to resolve "osv02.pvg.sipprovider.us" to OSV IP address, but because each FQDN is slightly different from the other, a new query is initiated. Each DNS response is also cached in sipsm. Since DNS queries are network and DNS server dependent, delays may block call processing which in turn may present an overload condition in sipsm. To ease and relax such situation, local/mini FQDN resolver is provided by this RTP-parm. - the IP addresses from this parm is validated against OSV's IP addresses. - the FQDN length shall be greater than 4 characters and shall include at least one dot. (e.g. "x.yy") - syntax "fqdn1:A<ipv4;ipv4>,fqdn_n:<ipv4_n1;ipv4_n2>" (space or special chars are NOT allowed) Example: ".osv01.pvg.sipprovider.us:A<10.10.50.10;10.10.51.10>,.osv01.pvg.sipprovider.com:A<10.10.50.11;10.10.51.11>"
RtpParameter.Range: comma reparated list of OSV FQDN

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/CleanAuthentication
RtpParameter.Description: Used to turn on Clean Authentication. Another way to authenticate.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/EnableSSOAuthentication
RtpParameter.Description: Used to turn on enable Single Sign On (SSO) Authentication.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/AccessTokenLifeTime
RtpParameter.Description: TTL in minutes for Ansible Client's Access Token.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/Phone_Context
RtpParameter.Description: FRN9647 AS-SIP-Appliance JITC Used to update add phone-context parameter within the contact header for outgoing INVITE messages only

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/Trunk_Context
RtpParameter.Description: FRN9647 AS-SIP-Appliance JITC Used to update add trunk-context parameter within the contact header for outgoing INVITE messages only

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/CCA_ID
RtpParameter.Description: FRN9647 AS-SIP-Appliance JITC Used to update the CCA-ID parameter within the contact header for outgoing INVITE messages only

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/BypassDA
RtpParameter.Description: bypassing digest authentication for some message types depending which flags are on

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/IncludeOsvUserAgentVersionInfo
RtpParameter.Description: FRN9367 Parameter to enable the inclusion of the version of OSV in the SIP message as part of the User-Agent header. If parameter is: RtpTrue. Enables the inclusion of the OSV version in the User-Agent header. RtpFalse. Disables the inclusion of the OSV version in the User-Agent header.(default)

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/PrecedencePreemptionNetworkDomain
RtpParameter.Description: JITC: Resource Priority OSV SC Network Domain. Valid values for OSV SC are 'uc' and 'dsn'.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/PrecedencePreemptionPrecedenceDomain
RtpParameter.Description: JITC: Resource Priority OSV SC Precedence Domain.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/AcceptedPrecedencePreemptionNetworkDomain
RtpParameter.Description: JITC: Accepted Resource Priority Network Domain list.
RtpParameter.Range: Up to 32 comma separated strings, each with a max of 16 characters

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/AcceptedRPriorityValues
RtpParameter.Description: JITC: Accepted Resource Priority Value list.
RtpParameter.Range: Up to 8 comma separated single character IDs

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/AEIPrecedenceAndPreemption
RtpParameter.Description: JITC: allows EI to perform P&P when Busy in a call. Default is OSV SC performs P&P

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/sdpSessionMaintainer
RtpParameter.Description: Used to turn on RFC3264 compliance regarding 'o' and 'm' lines in SDP. JITC FRN 9970

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/enable_security_notification_3rd_party_devices
RtpParameter.Description: FRN9418 Notifications of Encrypted calls on behalf of Network EPs and 3rd Party device EPs Used to turn on security notification mechanism on behalf of Network EPs and 3rd Party device EPs.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/SuppressDTLS
RtpParameter.Description: Used to turn on/off the feature of FRN9491 for DTLS supression.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Sip/DefaultRegisterExpiresTimer
RtpParameter.Description: Default Expires timer in seconds in the absence of expires header / parameter

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/SipReg/RandomizeRegisterExpiration
RtpParameter.Description: Parameter to enable randomizing of expire times received in REGISTER messages. If no expire time is received the default will be used i.e., parameter below will have no effect. Otherwise, the expire time used will be a random time between the configured min and the given expire time. If set to false, SIP won't randomize any expire times for the corresponding message.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/SipReg/SRTPDeviceSupportList
RtpParameter.Description: FRN 2683 This is a blacklist of devices that DO NOT support best effort SRTP for MIKEY. Adding a device to this list will result in removing MIKEY lines from the SDP sent to that device.
RtpParameter.Range: User Agents that support SRTP MIKEY (the value is case insensitive and partially matched, e.g. "abc" will match "abcde", "abc V1.2", etc.)

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/SipReg/UserAgentEpidBlackList
RtpParameter.Description: This table gives a list of devices that DO NOT support or have valid epid.
RtpParameter.Range: User Agents that DO NOT support valid epid

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/SipReg/SRTPDeviceSupportListSDES
RtpParameter.Description: FRN 3890 This is a blacklist of devices that DO NOT support best effort SRTP for SDES. Adding a device to this list will result in removing SDES lines from the SDP sent to that device.
RtpParameter.Range: User Agents that support SRTP SDES (the value is case insensitive and partially matched, e.g. "abc" will match "abcde", "abc V1.2", etc.)

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/SipReg/PeakProtectionFeature
RtpParameter.Description: FRN 4616 Feature Flag Enable/Disable Registration Peak Protection

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/SipReg/IceDeviceSupportList
RtpParameter.Description: This is a blacklist of devices that DOES NOT support best effort ICE. This is a comma seperated list. OSV searches the User Agent Header to see if it contains any of the entries in this list. The list can look like for example, "Cisco,iPhone,Xlite,Acme". A change to this entry requires delete/recreate of RTP. configurable by HiPath Assistant, CLI and SOAP;

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/SipReg/AeiDeviceSupportList
RtpParameter.Description: JITC: Used to identify devices that support AEI P&P procedures.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/SipReg/DTLSDeviceNoSupportList
RtpParameter.Description: This is a blacklist of devices that DOES NOT support DTLS. This is a comma seperated list. OSV searches the User Agent Header to see if it contains any of the entries in this list. The list can look like for example, "Cisco,Asterisk,Xlite". A change to this entry requires delete/recreate of RTP. configurable by HiPath Assistant, CLI and SOAP;
RtpParameter.Range: User Agents that do not support DTLS

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/E911/EnableRedSkyE911Manager
RtpParameter.Description: The Srx/Service/E911/EnableRedSkyE911Manager RTP parameter defines if OSV is integrated with RedSky manager

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/E911/NumberToAppend
RtpParameter.Description: The Srx/Service/E911/NumberToAppend RTP parameter defines the suffix which is appended to E911 PAC in order to route to RedSky Anywhere endpoint

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/E911/MaxRegistrationEventForRedSky
RtpParameter.Description: The Srx/Service/E911/MaxRegistrationEventForRedSky RTP parameter defines the maximum number of registration events per publish/notify
RtpParameter.Unit: number of registration records in xml mime

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/E911/PeriodicPublishTimer
RtpParameter.Description: The Srx/Service/E911/PeriodicPublishTimer RTP parameter defines the time in seconds that periodic publish msgs will be sent to RedSky mgr

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Irm/RtcpOverhead
RtpParameter.Description: Overhead percentage of RTP control protocol

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Irm/DefaultAudioBitRate
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the default Audio Codec bit rate

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Irm/AudioBitRate_G711A
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the G711A Audio Codec bit rate

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Irm/AudioBitRate_G711u
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the G711u Audio Codec bit rate

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Irm/AudioBitRate_G722
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the G722 Audio Codec bit rate

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Irm/AudioBitRate_G723_1
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the G723_1 Audio Codec bit rate

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Irm/AllowCodecRestrictionMS
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3542: This parameter (Srx/Irm/AllowCodecRestrictionMS) is introduced to control whether the CAC codec restrictions are applicable for calls to the Media Server. This parameter has three possible values: 0: No codec restrictions for MS connections 1: Apply codec restrictions for MS connections that impact the CAC policy. The codec restrictions are not applicable for MS connections that are ignored by the CAC Policy due to the "Ignore MS Calls" flag. 2: Apply codec restrictions for all MS connections, including the ones that are ignored by the CAC Policy due to the "Ignore MS Calls" flag

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Irm/PrioritizeLocationDomains
RtpParameter.Description: IRM prioritization for CAC groups based on different types This parameter controls the way of the IRM prioritization for CAC Groups based on different types and has two possible values: RtpTrue, RtpFalse RtpTrue: IRM prioritization for CAC groups based on different types should be 1. Location Domains 2. IP Addresses 3. Subnets (smaller subnets have higher priority) 4. DNs RtpFalse: IRM prioritization for CAC groups based on different types should be 1. IP Addresses 2. Subnets (smaller subnets have higher priority) 3. Location Domains 4. DNs
