RtpParameter.Name: Srx/IpPacketPriority/DSCPTOS/NCS/Type
RtpParameter.Description: Quality of Service (QoS) value for Network-Based Call Signaling. This parameter allow the setting of the Differentiated Services (DiffServ) bits for TOS or DSCP.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/IpPacketPriority/DSCPTOS/NCS/Value
RtpParameter.Description: Quality of Service (QoS) value for Network-Based Call Signaling. This parameter allow the setting of traffic class value (DSCP) or Type of Service value (TOS).

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/IpPacketPriority/DSCPTOS/SIP/Type
RtpParameter.Description: Quality of Service (QoS) value for SIP Signaling. This parameter determines if the value in Srx/IpPacketPriority/DSCPTOS/SIP/Value is expressed as Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) or as Type of Service (TOS)

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/IpPacketPriority/DSCPTOS/SIP/Value
RtpParameter.Description: Quality of Service (QoS) value for SIP Signaling. This parameter allow the setting of traffic class value (DSCP) or Type of Service value (TOS).

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/IpPacketPriority/DSCPTOS/RTP/Type
RtpParameter.Description: Quality of Service (QoS) value for voice traffic (RTP). This parameter determines if the value in Srx/IpPacketPriority/DSCPTOS/RTP/Value is expressed as Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) or as Type of Service (TOS) This parameter is only used for OpenScape Mobile clients. Changes to the value are applied to the mobile client when the client (re)enters Wi-Fi or is turned off and back on.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/IpPacketPriority/DSCPTOS/RTP/Value
RtpParameter.Description: Quality of Service (QoS) value for the media (RTP) stream between devices. This parameter allows the configuration of traffic class value (DSCP) or Type of Service value (TOS) to ensure the media traffic gets enough priority in the network. This parameter is currently used only OpenScape Mobile client. Changes to the value are applied to the mobile client when the client (re)enters Wi-Fi or is turned off and back on.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/IpPacketPriority/EnableWmm
RtpParameter.Description: Enables/disables signaling and media traffic shaping in the wireless network using the 802.11e standard. The value takes effect the next time OpenScape Mobile is initialized (reenters Wi-Fi or is manually turned off and back on). RtpTrue enables traffic shaping, RtpFalse disables it. This parameter is currently used only OpenScape Mobile client. Changes to the value are applied to the mobile client when the client (re)enters Wi-Fi or is turned off and back on.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/IpPacketPriority/DSCPTOS/VRTP/Type
RtpParameter.Description: Quality of Service (QoS) value for video traffic (RTP). This parameter determines if the value in Srx/IpPacketPriority/DSCPTOS/RTP/Value is expressed as Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) or as Type of Service (TOS) This parameter is only used for OpenScape Mobile clients. Changes to the value are applied to the mobile client when the client (re)enters Wi-Fi or is turned off and back on.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/IpPacketPriority/DSCPTOS/VRTP/Value
RtpParameter.Description: Quality of Service (QoS) value for the video media (RTP) stream between devices. This parameter allows the configuration of traffic class value (DSCP) or Type of Service value (TOS) to ensure the media traffic gets enough priority in the network. This parameter is currently used only OpenScape Mobile client. Changes to the value are applied to the mobile client when the client (re)enters Wi-Fi or is turned off and back on.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/IpPacketPriority/DSCPTOS/CSTA/Type
RtpParameter.Description: Quality of Service (QoS) value for CSTA Signaling. This parameter determines if the value in Srx/IpPacketPriority/DSCPTOS/CSTA/Value is expressed as Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) or as Type of Service (TOS)virtual IP addresses.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/IpPacketPriority/DSCPTOS/CSTA/Value
RtpParameter.Description: Quality of Service (QoS) value for CSTA Signaling. This parameter allows the setting of traffic class value (DSCP) or Type of Service value (TOS).

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/Address
RtpParameter.Description: soapServer startUp Parm Indicates the IP address on which the SOAP Server should listen to receive SOAP requests. SoapServer will process requests only on this adapter. To accept requests on any adapter specify 0.0.0.0. This parameter defaults to 0.0.0.0.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/Port
RtpParameter.Description: soapServer startUp Parm Indicates the port on which the first instance of the SOAP server should listen to receive SOAP requests. When NumberOfInstances > 1, this is the first of NumberOfInstances ports. This parameter defaults to 8767.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/NumberOfInstances
RtpParameter.Description: soapServer startUp Parm Indicates the number of SOAP server child processes to run. Each child processes requests on a single port. This parameter defaults to 4.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/Priority
RtpParameter.Description: soapServer startUp Parm soapServer uses Priority routines which incorporate GNU functions

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/OverLoadCheckPeriod
RtpParameter.Description: soapServer startUp Parm Indicates the time period after which to check for overload conditions on the system. Subscriber provisioning checks the congestion level after this time period. It rejects requests for this period of time when in congestion. This parameter defaults to 0 seconds.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/OverLoadLevel1Sleep
RtpParameter.Description: submgtSchedule startUp Parm The number of seconds to sleep when the system is in congestion/overload level 1. The default is 30.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/OverLoadLevel2Sleep
RtpParameter.Description: submgtSchedule startUp Parm The number of seconds to sleep when the system is in congestion/overload level 2. The default is 60.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/OverLoadLevel3Sleep
RtpParameter.Description: submgtSchedule startUp Parm The number of seconds to sleep when the system is in congestion/overload level 3. The default is 120.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/SubSchedPriority
RtpParameter.Description: submgtSchedule startUp Parm Sun Unix priority used by job scheduler

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/JobCheckSleep
RtpParameter.Description: submgtSchedule startUp Parm Indicates the number of seconds for the submgtSchedule process to pause between checks for new jobs. This parameter defaults to 10.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/NumObjectsToPauseAfter
RtpParameter.Description: submgtSchedule startUp Parm Indicates the number of objects after which the submgtSchedule process pauses. SubmgtSchedule cascades feature changes to multiple subscribers. This parameter is used to limit the impact of this processing on the switch. This parameter defaults to 20.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/JobLoopSleepTime
RtpParameter.Description: submgtSchedule startUp Parm Indicates the time (in seconds) submgtSchedule sleeps after processing <NumObjectsToPauseAfter> objects. It is worth mentioning that the default value of 0 will cause the submgtSchedule not to sleep for any amount of time, but will give up the processor to allow other processes to run. This parameter is used to limit the impact of this processing on the switch. This parameter defaults to 0.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/JobClearTime
RtpParameter.Description: submgtSchedule startUp Parm Indicates the time of day at which the submgtSchedule process checks for and removes old jobs. The (jobs) results of the feature cascadings are maintained for a user-defined number of days. This parameter reflects the time of day that these files are purged. The format is 24HH:MM. This parameter defaults to 02:00.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/ClearJobDays
RtpParameter.Description: submgtSchedule startUp Parm Indicates the number of days after which the submgtSchedule process removes successfully completed jobs. This parameter defaults to 3 days.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/ClearErrorDays
RtpParameter.Description: submgtSchedule startUp Parm Indicates the number of days after which the submgtSchedule process removes jobs that ended abnormally (failed, partial and cancelled jobs). This parameter defaults to 5 days.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/DebugGsoap
RtpParameter.Description: submgtSchedule startUp Parm traces the gsoap stack

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/TombstoneKeepRecordsInterval
RtpParameter.Description: submgtSchedule startUp Parm Number of days after which entries from Tombstone table will be purged.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/SoapHomeDNReturnCodeRelease
RtpParameter.Description: soapPCMMServer startUp Parm R12.0:different returncodes for provisioning in R10.1 and R12 possible values: 10 = R10.1, 11 = R.11 and later

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/StartingPortWithTLS
RtpParameter.Description: 0576 - Security on soapServer parms The starting port with TLS to listen in

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/NumberOfInstancesWithTLS
RtpParameter.Description: 0576 - Security on soapServer parms Number of SOAP Servers to be instantiated.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Subp/Authorization
RtpParameter.Description: 0576 - Security on soapServer parms If this parameter is true then the SOAP/XML input coming into the OSV must be checked for authorization.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TLS_Disabled
RtpParameter.Description: Disables TLS functionality

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/TLSVersion
RtpParameter.Description: Indicates the minimum TLS version which is supported

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/IdentityVerificationEnabled
RtpParameter.Description: Enables the TLS Identity verification by SIP feature.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/VerificationField
RtpParameter.Description: Field to be used to get FQDN/IP address to send to SIP.
RtpParameter.Unit: Enumerated value - only 0 supported so far

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/VerificationProfile
RtpParameter.Description: Name of profile to indicate which fields in certificate need to be checked.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/RFC5626/PingIntervalTimer
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies the maximum idle time on an outgoing TLS connection before an RFC5626 ping is sent. The actual interval used is a random time between 80% and 100% of parameter.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/RFC5626/PingTimeoutInterval
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies the time to wait for an RFC5626 pong response to a ping. This value is fixed by RFC 5626 (section 4.4.1).

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/RFC5626/PingFailureThreshold
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies the number of failed pings before an outgoing TLS connection is terminated. BO states this value can be from 1 to 5. However, RFC 5626 (section 4.4.1) states this can only be 1.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/RFC5746/SessionRenegotiation
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter switches on/off the ability to perform TLS renegotiation with peer devices. If switched off then no renegotiation is performed.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/RFC5746/EnforceSecureSessionRenegotiation
RtpParameter.Description: Terminates/Refuses a TLS connection from a client or towards a server that does not support the RFC5746 Secure Compliant Session Renegotiation feature.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/RFC5746/SecureSessionRenegotiationInterval
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies the time after which a session renegotiation must be done on a TLS connection.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/RFC5746/SecureSessionRenegotiationSize
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies the number of megabytes transmitted on the TLS connection after which a session renegotiation must be done.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/MutualAuth/Client/VerificationLevel
RtpParameter.Description: There are three levels of verification for MTLS connections: 0 (None) - No verification 1 (Trusted) - Chain is checked against CA store and expiration 2 (Full) - Level 1 + key usage, extended key usage critical extensions are checked This parameter allows the setting of that verification level

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/MutualAuth/Client/IdentityVerificationEnabled
RtpParameter.Description: TLS connections can have post-connection validation performed upon them where the certificate that the peer offers is checked for validity. The checks performed at the current time are that if there is a subject alternative name within the certificate and that if that name contains either DNS or IP addresses that these DNS values and/or IP addresses are checked against the IP address of the peer presenting the certificate. If the DNS/IP address does not match the IP Address of the peer the the connection is closed automatically. If there is no subject alternative name within the certificate, the the common name within the subject name is assumed to be a DNS. This is then checked against the IP address of the peer presenting the certificate. If the DNS address does not match the IP Address of the peer the the connection is closed automatically.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/MutualAuth/Client/EnableCRLChecking
RtpParameter.Description: Indicates whether the CRL Checking feature is activated.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/MutualAuth/Server/VerificationLevel
RtpParameter.Description: There are three levels of verification for MTLS connections: 0 (None) - No verification 1 (Trusted) - Chain is checked against CA store and expiration 2 (Full) - Level 1 + key usage, extended key usage critical extensions are checked This parameter allows the setting of that verification level

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/MutualAuth/Server/IdentityVerificationEnabled
RtpParameter.Description: TLS connections can have post-connection validation performed upon them where the certificate that the peer offers is checked for validity. The checks performed at the current time are that if there is a subject alternative name within the certificate and that if that name contains either DNS or IP addresses that these DNS values and/or IP addresses are checked against the IP address of the peer presenting the certificate. If the DNS/IP address does not match the IP Address of the peer the the connection is closed automatically. If there is no subject alternative name within the certificate, the the common name within the subject name is assumed to be a DNS. This is then checked against the IP address of the peer presenting the certificate. If the DNS address does not match the IP Address of the peer the the connection is closed automatically.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/MutualAuth/Server/EnableCRLChecking
RtpParameter.Description: Indicates whether the CRL Checking feature is activated.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/CSTAMutualAuth/Server/VerificationLevel
RtpParameter.Description: There are three levels of verification for MTLS connections: 0 (None) - No verification 1 (Trusted) - Chain is checked against CA store and expiration 2 (Full) - Level 1 + key usage, extended key usage critical extensions are checked This parameter allows the setting of that verification level

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/CSTAMutualAuth/Server/IdentityVerificationEnabled
RtpParameter.Description: TLS connections can have post-connection validation performed upon them where the certificate that the peer offers is checked for validity. The checks performed at the current time are that if there is a subject alternative name within the certificate and that if that name contains either DNS or IP addresses that these DNS values and/or IP addresses are checked against the IP address of the peer presenting the certificate. If the DNS/IP address does not match the IP Address of the peer the the connection is closed automatically. If there is no subject alternative name within the certificate, the the common name within the subject name is assumed to be a DNS. This is then checked against the IP address of the peer presenting the certificate. If the DNS address does not match the IP Address of the peer the the connection is closed automatically.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/CSTAMutualAuth/Server/EnableCRLChecking
RtpParameter.Description: Indicates whether the CRL Checking feature is activated.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/Soap/Server/VerificationLevel
RtpParameter.Description: There are three levels of verification for MTLS connections: 0 (None) - No verification 1 (Trusted) - Chain is checked against CA store and expiration 2 (Full) - Level 1 + key usage, extended key usage critical extensions are checked This parameter allows the setting of that verification level

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/Soap/Server/IdentityVerificationEnabled
RtpParameter.Description: TLS connections can have post-connection validation performed upon them where the certificate that the peer offers is checked for validity. The checks performed at the current time are that if there is a subject alternative name within the certificate and that if that name contains either DNS or IP addresses that these DNS values and/or IP addresses are checked against the IP address of the peer presenting the certificate. If the DNS/IP address does not match the IP Address of the peer the the connection is closed automatically. If there is no subject alternative name within the certificate, the the common name within the subject name is assumed to be a DNS. This is then checked against the IP address of the peer presenting the certificate. If the DNS address does not match the IP Address of the peer the the connection is closed automatically.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/Soap/Server/EnableCRLChecking
RtpParameter.Description: Indicates whether the CRL Checking feature is activated.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/AnsMutualAuth/OSV/KeyStore
RtpParameter.Description: Stores the name of the file containing the OSV certificate for Ansible to encrypt the SSO Authorization Document and the key to decrypt the resulting SSO Token

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/AnsMutualAuth/OSV/KeyStorePath
RtpParameter.Description: Stores the path of the file containing the OSV certificate for Ansible to encrypt the SSO Authorization Document and the key to decrypt the resulting SSO Token

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/AnsMutualAuth/Ansible/Certificates
RtpParameter.Description: Stores the name of the file containing the public certificate of Ansible to verify the signature of the SSO Token

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/AnsMutualAuth/TrustedCAStorePath
RtpParameter.Description: This stores the path of the Trusted CA Certificate Store which contains the files which issued the Ansible and the OSV certificate in regards to SSO Token decryption/signature verification.

RtpParameter.Name: SSL/AnsMutualAuth/TrustedCAStore
RtpParameter.Description: This stores the name of the Trusted CA Certificate Store which contains the files which issued the Ansible and the OSV certificate in regards to SSO Token decryption/signature verification.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TTUD/CRLRootCA
RtpParameter.Description: Common Name of the Issuer or Owner of the Root Certificate Authority (CA). CRLs are only checked for certificates issued by this Root CA.
RtpParameter.Range: Characters allowed in Common Name of an X.500 Directory Name

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/E911/EmergencySNMPEvent
RtpParameter.Description: FRN4085 Emergency Call SNMP Trap Value: RtpFalse - Do not raise SNMP Alarm event for emergency call attempts RtpTrue - Raise SNMP Alarm event for emergency call attempts

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Mlhg/EndOfNoAnswerTimer
RtpParameter.Description: This RTP parameter is created by FRN3501 to enable an optional timer to force answer a queued call. This timer only applies to MLHG with Announcement Intercept and "No Answer" option. The default parameter value is 0 which means MLHG shall not set the timer when call is queued. Answer will be sent only after call is dequeued. The minimum value of this parameter is 30 and the maximum is 600.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Mlhg/AutoMakeBusyAllGroups
RtpParameter.Description: This RTP parameter enables the setting of the subscriber's Hunt Make Busy status to active in all Hunt Groups where the subscriber is a member as a result of an Auto-Make Busy trigger.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/MOH/MOHAnnouncementTimer
RtpParameter.Description: FRN6735 This parameter MOHAnnouncementTimer specifies the value of the timer set by the MOH service when trying to provide MOH played by the media server to the held party. The default value (zero) means that no timer is set. For any other positive integer value in valid range, a timer is set and upon expiration local/phone music is provided to the held party. Of course, the timer (if it has been set) is going to expire only if the MOH service did not manage to provide to the held party MOH played by the MS in the meanwhile.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/Rec/EnablePhoneRecordingCallerId
RtpParameter.Description: Controls the addition of the Diversion header with the connected party's display identity in the phone recording call

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CcsRecallTimerT4
RtpParameter.Description: Timer T4 (Recall Supervision originating timer) is started on sending a CCS recall indication to the CCBS/CCNR subscriber and is stopped on receipt of an answer to this indication. Running on the Originating side.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CcsIdleGuardT8
RtpParameter.Description: Timer T8 (Destination Idle Guard) specifies the amount of time the system will wait after the callback destination has become available and before recalling/notifying the CCBS/CCNR subscriber. Running on the Terminating side.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CcsRecallT9
RtpParameter.Description: Timer T9 (Recall Supervision teminating timer) is started on sending a CCS recall indication to the CCBS/CCNR subscriber and, is stopped upon destination subscriber is ringing due to callback execution call. Running on the Terminating side. T9=T4+5

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CcsRecallT9_EXT
RtpParameter.Description: Timer T9_EXT (Recall Supervision terminating timer) Is used in scenarios when the callback request has arrived via a SIPQ endpoint. In case of networks that do not support suspend/resume functionality(CCBS/CCNR subscriber has become busy during callback execution), should be adjusted to a value equal or slightly less than Srx/Service/CCS/CcnrServiceSupervisionT7 or Srx/Service/CCS/CcbsServiceSupervisionT7 timers (default value 1800 sec). T9_EXT timer is started on sending a CCS recall indication to the CCBS/CCNR subscriber and is stopped when destination subscriber is ringing due to callback execution call. Running on the Terminating side. T9_EXT=T4+5

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CcbsRequestOperationT2
RtpParameter.Description: Timer T2 (CC Request Supervision timer) specifies the amount of time the callback monitoring process will wait for a response by the signalling manager concerning the destination subscriber status (busy/idle) Running both sides.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CcbsServiceDurationT3
RtpParameter.Description: Timer T3 (CC Duration originating timer) specifies the overall time a CCBS request will be maintained into the system before getting deleted, canceled or completed. Running on the Originating side.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CcbsServiceSupervisionT7
RtpParameter.Description: Timer T7 (CC Duration terminating timer) specifies the overall time a CCBS request will be maintained into the system before getting deleted, canceled or completed. Running on the Terminating side

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CcnrRequestOperationT2
RtpParameter.Description: Timer T2 (CC Request Supervision timer) specifies the amount of time the callback monitoring process will wait for a response by the signalling manager concerning the destination subscriber status (busy/idle) Running both sides

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CcnrServiceDurationT3
RtpParameter.Description: Timer T3 (CC Duration originating timer) specifies the overall time a CCNR request will be maintained into the system before getting deleted,canceled or completed. Running on the Originating side.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CcnrServiceSupervisionT7
RtpParameter.Description: Timer T7 (CC Duration terminating timer) specifies the overall time a CCNR request will be maintained into the system before getting deleted, canceled or completed. Running on the Terminating side

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/MaxNumInCCBSActivationsAllowedPerCustomer
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies the number of allowable CCBS requests per callback destination subscriber

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/MaxNumOutCCBSActivationsAllowedPerCustomer
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies the number of allowable CCBS requests per CCBS requestor

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/MaxNumInCCNRActivationsAllowedPerCustomer
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies the number of allowable CCNR requests per callback destination subscriber

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/MaxNumOutCCNRActivationsAllowedPerCustomer
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies the number of allowable CCNR requests per CCNR requestor

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CCBSFeatureAssignedPerOffice
RtpParameter.Description: Indicates if CCBS feature is assigned to the local subscribers

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CCNRFeatureAssignedPerOffice
RtpParameter.Description: Indicates if the CCNR feature is assigned to the local subscribers

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CCBSActivationCCS
RtpParameter.Description: Indicates if activation of CCBS is allowed via prefix access code.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CCSSCallIndSupport
RtpParameter.Description: Indicates if network supports the CCS indication for CCS calls.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CCSHandleAsEmergencyCall
RtpParameter.Description: Indicates if a CC callback execution call is handled as an emergency call, in order to succeed a voice path when whole of the bandwith is reserved.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CCSCacTimerForReleaseB
RtpParameter.Description: Callback execution retry timer defines the time between an unsuccesfull callback execution attempt and the next one, due to interaction with CF, DND, IRM etc Running on the Terminating side.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CCSCacTimerForReleaseA
RtpParameter.Description: Callback execution retry timer defines the time between an unsuccesfull CCBS/CCNR recall attempt and the next one, due to interaction with CF, DND, IRM etc Running on the Originating side

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CCS/CcnrOnAnswer
RtpParameter.Description: Defines if CCNR activation is allowed after an answered call, between the CCNR requestor and the callback destination.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/BgSILM/BGSilmTagLimit
RtpParameter.Description: BGSilmTagLimit parameter describes the min/max value of the MonitorTagLimit. Min value equals to zero 0 has the meaning that there is no limit.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CFLoopMaxCount
RtpParameter.Description: Contains the max forwarding limit when CF Loop Prevention is on

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CFLoopMaxCountExtended
RtpParameter.Description: Contains the extended max forwarding limit when CF Loop Prevention is on Extended is designed to be used on endpoints where common numbers are used

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CFRDefaultClassOfRestriction
RtpParameter.Description: This RTP parameter defines the default CFR class of restriction

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CFBlockForwardingToEmergency
RtpParameter.Description: This RTP parameter is Used to block or allow forwarding to Emergency numbers

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/Auth/AuthHidePinCdr
RtpParameter.Description: This RTP parameter is used to hide or show Personal Pin to CDRs. Personal Pin is an Authorization Code which is associated with a subscriber and it is characterized as Business or Private. When the parameter is true the Personal Pin should be replaced with '***' in CDRs.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CALEA/BGBlock
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies whether CALEA surveillance is allowed for calls between members of the same BG. Value: RtpFalse - existing behaviour, i.e. surveillance of internal and external calls RtpTrue - no surveillance for bg internal calls

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CALEA/EnableCCCMediaSecNeg
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies whether call content (voice) surveillance is allowed if a media type with encryption is requested Value: RtpFalse - No call content surveillance if a media type with encryption is requested RtpTrue - Allow call content negotiation with media security with the media server number format

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Service/CALEA/CALEAWorkingMode
RtpParameter.Description: Determine CALEA mode of operation ANSI, ETSI(LIOS) or SORM. Value: 0 - Undefined (Not used anymore. It was used in combination with obsolete LIOSMode RTP parameter.) 1 - Calea operates in normal mode (ANSI mode) 2 - Calea operates in LIOS mode (using a LIOS server ETSI functionality must be configured) 3 - Calea operates in SORM mode (for Russian market)

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/PrttReader/ReadFromDriver
RtpParameter.Description: ReadFromDriver: Defines a flag indicating whether the Persistent RTT reader process should connect to the RTT driver and read trace records. If running the OPRTT_READ wrapper routine, users may want to clear this value to avoid records being stolen by the persistent reader process between activations of the command line oprtt_read. Warning clearing this parameter value will effectively disable call tracing functionality on the system. As an alternative, consider using the NonCallTraceDevEnvSupported parameter to write non- call trace data into aged files (see below)

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/PrttReader/ContTraceDirectory
RtpParameter.Description: ContTraceDirectory: Defined the Continuous Trace directory.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/PrttReader/ContTraceFileSize
RtpParameter.Description: ContTraceFileSize: RTT reader max continuous trace data file size

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/PrttReader/ContTraceNumberFiles
RtpParameter.Description: ContTraceNumberFiles: Defines the number of continuous trace data files to keep

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/PrttReader/RunBothCallTraceContTrace
RtpParameter.Description: RunBothCallTraceContTrace: Defines if continuous trace and call trace can be run in paralel. By default if Call Trace is activated then Continuous Trace is disabled.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/PrttReader/ContTraceForceAgingTime
RtpParameter.Description: ContTraceForceAgingTime: Defines the longest duration time a trace file can exists befor being aged.

RtpParameter.Name: app/prmgr/iMS_AUDIT_ON_OFF
RtpParameter.Description: MS auditing on/off. ON=1, OFF=2.MS audit (AUEP MS instead of ping).Media Server EP Auditing parameters

RtpParameter.Name: app/prmgr/iMS_AUDIT_HEARTBEAT_PERIOD
RtpParameter.Description: The interval in milliseconds between two subsequent audits to the same MS

RtpParameter.Name: app/prmgr/iMS_AUDIT_THREAD_DELAY_MIN_TIME
RtpParameter.Description: Thread loop delay to restrict the thread speed

RtpParameter.Name: app/prmgr/iMS_AUDIT_BLK_THRES
RtpParameter.Description: Number of unsuccesful audits, that trigger PRM to block the MS via RTM (operational=blocked)

RtpParameter.Name: app/prmgr/iMS_AUDIT_UBLK_THRES
RtpParameter.Description: Number of succesful audits, that trigger PRM to unblock the blocked MS via RTM (operational=active)

RtpParameter.Name: app/prmgr/iSIP_AUDIT_INTERVAL_TIMER
RtpParameter.Description: The interval in minutes between two subsequent audits to the same endpoint SIP Audits.SIP EP Auditing parameters

RtpParameter.Name: app/prmgr/iSIP_AUDIT_SUPERVISION_TIMER
RtpParameter.Description: The interval in hours where an audited endpoint is removed from the list if it does not respond

RtpParameter.Name: app/prmgr/iSIP_AUDIT_QUANTITY
RtpParameter.Description: simultaneous active audits

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/SystemHealthCheck1
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 RtpTrue means Node 1 Test Call Generator timer is running and feature is ON

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/SystemHealthCheck2
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 RtpTrue means node 2 Test Call Generator timer is running and feature is ON

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/ListenPortPrimaryEndpoint
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Port to be used for communication from/to the test call generators. The port is opened for each SIP Listener on the primary SIP IP address

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/ListenPortPrimaryKeyset
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Port to be used for communication from/to the test call generators. The port is opened for each SIP Listener on the primary SIP IP address

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/ListenPortFailoverEndpoint
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Port to be used for communication from/to the test call generators. The port is opened for each SIP Listener on the secondary SIP IP address if there is one

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/ListenPortFailoverKeyset
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Port to be used for communication from/to the test call generators. The port is opened for each SIP Listener on the secondary SIP IP address if there is one

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/TestCycleInterval
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Test cycle in seconds

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/TestFailureThreshold
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Number of failures to advance a recovery measure level.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/TestSuccessThreshold
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Number of successes to go back to the green level

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/RecoveryMeasureLevel1
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 RecoveryMeasureLevel on *NODE 1* 0 = Not Run 1 = OK 2 = Overload 3 = Not OK

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/RecoveryMeasureLevel2
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 RecoveryMeasureLevel on *NODE 2* 0 = Not Run 1 = OK 2 = Overload 3 = Not OK

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/RecoveryMeasureLevelTimeStamp1
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Last time RecoveryMeasureLevel changed on node 1

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/RecoveryMeasureLevelTimeStamp2
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Last time RecoveryMeasureLevel changed on node 2

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/OfficeCode
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Default Office Code for test calls Srx/TCG/OfficeCode + x with x: 1, 2, 3 or 4 + 1 -> keyset DN node1 + 2 -> keyset DN node2 + 3 -> NNI DN node1 + 4 -> NNI DN node2

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/TestDN1
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Default Keyset DN Node 1

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/TestDN2
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Default Keyset DN Node 2

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/TEST_NPID
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Default NPID for test call translation

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/BG_NAME
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Default Business Group Name

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/OverrideTCGProvisioningHiding
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Controls the hiding of the special TCG office code and business group

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/AllowForcingProxiesToSurvivableMode
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Specifies whether the Test Call Generator (TCG) on a simplex or failed-over duplex system should force all proxies to survivable mode when the test call status is "Not OK".

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/TestCallEpName1
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Determines the node 1 NNI endpoint display name

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/TCG/TestCallEpName2
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3347 Determines the node 2 NNI endpoint display name

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Lic/DynamicWarningThres
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter sets the percentage of Dynamic Licenses used before a warning message is sent advising the user to purchase more Dynamic Licenses. NOTE: Removing this parameter requires CLI and NMC changes as well!
RtpParameter.Unit: percentage of total dynamic licenses used.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Lic/OSMOWarningThres
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter sets the percentage of OSMO Licenses used before a warning message is sent advising the user to purchase more OSMO Licenses. NOTE: Removing this parameter requires CLI and NMC changes as well!
RtpParameter.Unit: percentage of total OSMO licenses used.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/OMLoggingOnOff
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter activates or de-activates the OMM process The Operational Management Measurements component keeps statistics in log files (CSV format) Valid values are: 1 - Enable OMM 2 - Disable OMM

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/SvcAssignedPerOfficeACR
RtpParameter.Description: Defines whether the service is switch-wide provisioned

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/SvcAssignedPerOfficeCIDS
RtpParameter.Description: Defines whether the service is switch-wide provisioned

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/SvcAssignedPerOfficeMCT
RtpParameter.Description: Defines whether the service is switch-wide provisioned

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/CALEASurveillance
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter determines if CALEA surveillance is active on the switch. If this parameter is set to 0 then no call will be monitored.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/OwnCountryCode
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter is meaningful only when all the subscribers are situated in one country. It is used when National Numbers are provisioned in the switch (a subscriber DN without countryCode prefixed). If set, it defines the code of the country of operation, and all configured national numbers will belong to that country. This parameter is used by many components SIPSM, CSTA, UCE, NDAL either to set nature of address of a received GNF number (under certain conditions only) and some times to convert a national DN into GNF format. This parameter is also used by XLA for ENUM calls or to prefix country code in outgoing party number and when the countryCode is not provisioned in the destination code table.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/SrxSwitchLangMode
RtpParameter.Description: Defines language support on the switch with one of the following possible values: 1 - Single Language 2 - Multi-Language (meaning that subscribers can be provisioned with their language of choice for announcements) The default value is 1.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/SrxDefaultLang
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the default language for the switch. This is the language used when a language code is not specified individually for a subscriber or other entity. The default value is 1 (English).

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/SrxSupportedLangList
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the list of possible supported languages. The parameter is a comma separated string of up to 20 language codes (for example "1,2,3"). The default value is 1 (English), and the numeric values correspond to other languages defined internally.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/CorrelationInfoUsage
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter determines for ETSI-style lawful interception if the correlation information is passed along in a UUS1 container (1) or using the calling party subaddress (2).

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/OPID
RtpParameter.Description: FRN0170 - H8k support for ETSI-style lawful interception The OPID identifies the switch owner in a unique way, using a 5 character string. It is a mandatory parameter in the HI3 correlation signalling and in the HI2 IRI records.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/COLPReq
RtpParameter.Description: FRN0170 - H8k support for ETSI-style lawful interception The COLPReq rtp defines if COLP check is needed to verify the Call Content channels.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/LIRetryTimer
RtpParameter.Description: When the switch is working in LIOS mode this parameter determines the timeout for the connection to the LEAs (CALEA functionality).

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/CFMaxDiversions
RtpParameter.Description: Contains the max forwarding limit (Hop Count)

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/SvcAssignedPerOfficeLONR
RtpParameter.Description: Indicates if the LONR feature is assigned to the local subscribers

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/SvcAssignedPerOfficeLINR
RtpParameter.Description: Indicates if the LINR feature is assigned to the local subscribers

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/ActDNDCfmTreat
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies if a tone or DND activation announcement will be played during DND activation via prefix access code

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/DActDNDCfmTreat
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies if a tone or DND deactivation announcement will be played during DND deactivation via prefix access code

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/DNDAnnAlways
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies if the DND rejection announcement will be played in case of inter BG calls(external calls) to the DND subscriber.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/CFVMCompatibility
RtpParameter.Description: If set to 'true' then the call will be forwarded according to the interactions between all the forwarding services provisioned. If this parameter is set to 'false' then the Call Forward to Voicemail feature cannot forward the call to the voice mail destination. The Call Forward to Voicemail feature must be provisioned in order for a subscriber to receive a message waiting indication. This parameter should be defaulted to 'true' so that subscribers can use either Call Forward Don't Answer, Call Forward Busy Line, or Call Forward Voicemail to forward his calls to voicemail and still receive his message waiting indication.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/LCSMaxNumConfPorts
RtpParameter.Description: The parameter LCSMaxNumConfPorts indicates the Maximum Number of Conference Ports per Conference Endpoint.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/MwiOnVMInactive
RtpParameter.Description: Indicates whether a Message Waiting Indication (MWI) can be sent to a voicemail subscriber while the subscriber has the voicemail feature ASSIGNED but not ACTIVE.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/MwiUseTranslatorOutputDn
RtpParameter.Description: Determine the DN number used to populate a Message Waiting Indication (MWI)sent to a voicemail subscriber. If set to 'false' OSV will use the number format as received from the voice mail server. If set to 'true' OSV will populate the message using the subscriber's registered DN information. In the Enterprise environment (with only SIP subscribers), it is recommended to set this parameter to "true".

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/MwiNatureOfAddress
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter sets the Nature of Address value used to translate the voicemail subscriber's DN in the MWI request in order to find a route for the MWI to be sent to the voicemail subscriber. Valid values are: 0(Unknown), 1(National), 2 (International).

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/MwiEnablePrivateNumberingPlan
RtpParameter.Description: Determines whether a Private Numbering Plan or the Global Numbering Plan will be used to translate the Message Waiting Indication DN. If this parameter is set to "true" then a Private Numbering Plan will be used. If so then the following must also be provisioned: 1) Provision the Endpoint Profile/ Subscriber Profile for the Voicemail Server (VMS) with the Numbering Plan ID needed to translate the voicemail subscriber's private DN. 2) Provision the VMS's IP address as an alias for the VMS's endpoint.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/ResourceMgmtEnabled
RtpParameter.Description: FRN1148 - This parameter is used to enable the interface to IRM (CAC).

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/ResourceMgmtType
RtpParameter.Description: FRN1148 - This parameter is used to define the resource manager to be used.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/ResourceMgmtTimeout
RtpParameter.Description: FRN1148 - This parameter defines the timeout value for a request sent to the resource manager.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/ResourceMgmtThresAlarm
RtpParameter.Description: FRN1148 - This parameter defines the number of logged timeout events before an alarm is generated. If the number of logged events exceeds the configured number, an alarm is generated.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/NodeIdArea2Id
RtpParameter.Description: NodeID consists of three parameters: NodeIdArea0Id, NodeIdArea1Id and NodeIdArea2Id. These 3 parameters together are used to identify the node that created a Global Call ID/Global Thread ID.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/NodeIdArea1Id
RtpParameter.Description: NodeID consists of three parameters: NodeIdArea0Id, NodeIdArea1Id and NodeIdArea2Id. These 3 parameters together are used to identify the node that created a Global Call ID/Global Thread ID.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/NodeIdArea0Id
RtpParameter.Description: NodeID consists of three parameters: NodeIdArea0Id, NodeIdArea1Id and NodeIdArea2Id. These 3 parameters together are used to identify the node that created a Global Call ID/Global Thread ID.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/ccnrInd
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies if the CCNR service can be activated or not, even if it is assigned and enabled

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/ccbsInd
RtpParameter.Description: Specifies if the CCBS service can be activated or not, regardless if it is assigned and enabled

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/AccountCodeMinLen
RtpParameter.Description: This paramaeter defines the minimum length of the account code for the relevant service (ACCOUNT CODES) UNISP00116219

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/AccountCodeMaxLen
RtpParameter.Description: This paramaeter defines the maximum length of the account code for the relevant service (ACCOUNT CODES) UNISP00116219

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/ESNetworkElementID
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter is used when the switch is working in ETSI mode. The Network Element ID is used by the H8k in CALEA surveillance calls as the calling party number when setting up the Call Content channel to the TDM switch in the PSTN that hosts the HI3 interface to the LEMF.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/AccAckType
RtpParameter.Description: Subscriber with Post Dial Account Code feature shall be prompted to enter an account code. Prompt Tone can be any announcement or tone. Valid values are: 1 - Tone 2 - Announcement

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/AccountCodeType
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter defines the type of the Account Code Valid values are: 1 - Pre Dial Account Code : in this case the account code is dialled before the DN 2 - Post Dial Account Code: in this case the account code is dialled after the DN

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/AccountExcludeList
RtpParameter.Description: In order to make a system wide set of codes that can optionally be excluded from requiring account codes we define a pattern of DNs (for example by defining a specific office code) This parameter can keep up to 20 different pattern codes (separated by comma) that will be excluded from needing account codes. Each code can be up to 30 digits in length and it also be possible to use wild cards (% sign) to represent any digit in Account Code Exclude. For example 1%%%555 means match any 1+NPA+555. Default to an empty string."

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/AccountCodeLength
RtpParameter.Description: If an account code greater than the system maximum number of account code digits is entered, an error announcement is provided via this parameter. Default Account Code Length is 16.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/AccountCodeDelayToneTmr
RtpParameter.Description: Time Delay before play Prompt Tone to collect Account Code digits

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/SwedishLangCodeIsSwe
RtpParameter.Description: Set to 'true' if IPUnity is used as the MediaServer-GW and the Swedish language is provisioned. When no IPUnity is used or the Swedish language is not provisioned, should be set to 'false'.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/LongCallTime
RtpParameter.Description: This is the maximum length that a call, in hours, will remain active in UCE. After the expiration of this UCE timer the call will be torn down and a release sent to both sides of the call to return them to the idle condition. A long call timer value of 0 will disable this feature and leave a call up indefinitely. It is possible to determine if calls are being terminated by this mechanism by examining the following file: /log/HiqLogInfo.log. Whenever the feature is activated, entries with the following text will be generated: "Context Audit released hung context". Example: data => 'Context Audit released hung context=FF00010000000000AA71CD4DDFEF0500 StartTime=2011-13-05T18:00:14.9-0500 CallSide=0 DestDN=552133884242 OrigDN=552133884225 longCall=yes'

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/sendAPNAsNational
RtpParameter.Description: This Parameter is used to indicate whether to send the APN (Public Number for SIPQ) in National format

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/UseSendOnlyForMOH
RtpParameter.Description: When set to 'true', an indication is provided to the held party when put on hold and MOH is played (the held party will receive the SDP of the media server with Attribute (a): sendonly)

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/StartAnnDelayTimer
RtpParameter.Description: The parameter StartAnnDelayTimer specifies the value for the delay before start playing an announcement, after a connection with the Media Server is created.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/MSSMaxRerouteTimer
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the maximum overall timer for a creation of a MGCP endpoint, if multiple MS routes are available. Value 0, means no attempt to reroute.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/UseOnsDisplayForOsmo
RtpParameter.Description: CQ00152451: This parameter controls the use of ONS/OND info when calculating the display to be sent to an Osmo Ond device. When set to true, the display number sent to the OpenScape Mobile DN is calculated in regards to the ONS Dn. When set to false, the display number sent to the OpenScape Mobile DN is calculated in regards to the OND Dn.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/ACCDefaultClassOfRestriction
RtpParameter.Description: Only valid for post dial account codes This RTP parameter defines the default account code class of restriction If it is not set, then no post dial account code is needed to complete a call

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/EmergencyRinging
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3593 When an incoming emergency call terminates to an idle SIP subscriber and the value is 'RtpTrue', then an 'alert-emergency' ring tone indication is inserted in the Alert-info header.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/DAKSPeriodicTones
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3149 This parameter applies for DAKS 2-way intercom calls and defines if a periodic tone will be provided by the terminating switch. Its value is 0 for None or the interval in seconds with range 5 to 180 seconds

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/IntercomTerminatingControl
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3149 This parameter applies for 1-way intercom calls in the terminating switch and defines if a MS conference circuit will be created or not in order to control the speech path for the 1-way intercom call

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/UpdateDisplaysForExternalCalls
RtpParameter.Description: Determines whether the OpenScape Voice will update the displays for External Calls. If this parameter is set to RtpFalse (default), the OSV does not update the display for parties involved in an External call. If this parameter is set to RtpTrue, the OSV does update the display for parties involved in an External call whenever the partner information changes, in the same manner as for Internal Calls.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/UseBGDisplayNumberWhenNumberUnavailable
RtpParameter.Description: Determines whether the OpenScape Voice will update the displays for External Calls. If this parameter is set to RtpFalse (default), the OSV does not update the display for parties involved in an External call. If this parameter is set to RtpTrue, the OSV does update the display for parties involved in an External call whenever the partner information changes, in the same manner as for Internal Calls.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/AllowSubsReroutingForOND
RtpParameter.Description: FRN3815 This parameter controls whether Enhanced Subscriber Rerouting is allowed for Inbound ONS calls to an OND (ONS != OND).

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/AuthTRSOverride
RtpParameter.Description: The Srx/Main/AuthTRSOverride RTP parameter allows turning on toll restrictions based on an entered authorization code.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/AuthTRSOverrideValues
RtpParameter.Description: The Srx/Main/AuthTRSOverrideValues RTP parameter contains a semi-colon separated list of "attribute":"value" pairs where the "attribute" contains the leading digits of authorization codes for which the traffic types that are allowed to be called are recorded in the class of restriction named in "value". All traffic types that are not recorded are then restricted.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/AllowParkRetrieveFromExternalParty
RtpParameter.Description: FRN4149 This parameter is used to identify if an external party can retrieve a parked call RtpFalse: External parties cannot retrieve parked calls RtpTrue: External parties have permission to retrieve parked calls

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/EnableLowerSecurityZoneNotification
RtpParameter.Description: FRN4344 This parameter is used to enable notification of lower security zone RtpFalse: Notification of lower security zone is disabled RtpTrue: Nofification of lower security zone is enabled

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/HandleInterBGCallsAsInternal
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter removes the BG check for determination whether a call is internal or external RtpFalse: BG check is made for internal, external determination RtpTrue: BG check is removed and an internal determination is made Note: The Public/Off-net Traffic endpoint attribute is then the only way to indicate that traffic from a specific SIP endpoint is considered off-net traffic.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/CFSIEUseInitialCallStatus
RtpParameter.Description: CQ260763 This parameter is used to indicate whether CFISE should use the destination associated with the initial call status (Internal/External) or the call status upon the expiration of the CFSIE-DA timer or Getting the Busy Indication for CFSIE-BL RtpTrue: Use the Initial Call Status RtpFalse: Use the Call Status upon the Expiration of the Timer or getting the Busy Indication

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/OSVOperatingAsASSIPAppliance
RtpParameter.Description: FRN9643 This parameter is used to indicate that the OSV is operating in a DoD environment RtpTrue: OSV is operating in the Department Of Defense environment RtpFalse: OSV is not operating in the Department Of Defense environment

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/DivertRoutineCalls
RtpParameter.Description: FRN9644 This parameter is added to enable or disable diversion of ROUTINE precedence level calls RtpTrue: Allow diversion of ROUTINE Precedence level calls RtpFalse: Do not allow diversion of ROUTINE Precedence level calls

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Main/MlppEnable
RtpParameter.Description: FRN9643 This parameter is used to indicate that the OSV has MLPP enabled This includes the ability to handle both PEI and AEI preemption signaling and precedence calling RtpTrue: Enable MLPP operation inside the OSV RtpFalse: Disable MLPP operation inside the OSV

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/MobileClient/SBCList
RtpParameter.Description: IMPORTANT: support for TCP protocol in OpenScape Mobile is being deprecated. In future versions only TLS connections will be allowed, without fallback to TCP. To prepare for that, configure the SBC to use TLS connections and update Srx/MobileClient/SBCTLSList to send the SBC TLS connection information to OpenScape Mobile. SBC TCP IP address(es) for the Mobile Client. This is usually the same SBC address used for home workers. This address is used by the Mobile Client when it is outside of the corporate network. The Mobile Client will attempt to to register using TCP via this address when it is not able to register directly to OSV. Multiple SBC IP address can be configured by separated commas. This parameter doesn't have any effect if Srx/MobileClient/SBCTLSList is used.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/MobileClient/SBCTLSList
RtpParameter.Description: SBC TLS IP address(es) for the Mobile Client. This is usually the same SBC address used for home workers. This address is used by the Mobile Client when it is outside of the corporate network. The Mobile Client will attempt to to register using TLS via this address when it is not able to register directly to OSV. Multiple SBC IP address can be configured by separated commas. This parameter overrides Srx/MobileClient/SBCList.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/MobileClient/ServiceContactEmail
RtpParameter.Description: Contact email to report Mobile Client issues. This is the email address of the local support group, usually the IT or telecom group. This address will get the log files when the user chooses to email them to report an issue. It must be accessible from the internet, so it must be the fully qualified email, e.g. it.support@my.company.com.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/MobileClient/VoiceMailAccessGNF
RtpParameter.Description: This is the voicemail access number for the OpenScape Mobile subscribers. It's the number dialed to retrieve voicemail messages (and change voicemail box options). The number is translated using the Global Numbering Plan for all OpenScape Mobile users.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/MobileClient/TimeoutOSMONotReachable
RtpParameter.Description: The time OSV will wait before rerouting a call when the Mobile Client is still registered, but not reachable (doesn't send any reply to incoming calls). This usually indicates that the user walked out of Wi-Fi coverage while the Mobile Client was registered. OSV will redirect the call to another destination (desk or cell) after this timer expires.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/MobileClient/DisabledCodecs
RtpParameter.Description: This parameter is now obsolete. Use Srx/MobileClient/wifiCodecPriorityList to configure the preferred order of codecs. Leave out of that list the codecs you do not want to use.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/MobileClient/wifiCodecPriorityList
RtpParameter.Description: Lists the allowed voice codec names for the Mobile Client when connected to Wi-Fi. The parameter contains a comma-separated list of codec names in prioritized order with the first codec in the list having the highest priority. Changes to the value are applied to the Mobile Client when the client (re)enters Wi-Fi or is turned off and back on. The following codecs are supported: ISAC, PCMU, PCMA, G722, G729, G729B, and iLBC. G729 and G729B are mutually exclusive codecs. OSMO should ignore G729 if both codecs are received.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/MobileClient/mediaSecurityModeOsv
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the security mode used for voice media on Mobile Clients when connected to OSV directly(without SBC) Changes to the value are applied to the Mobile Client When the client (re)enters Wi-Fi or is turned off and back on Valies: 0 - RTP Only: InSecure Calls are possible only and media is neither authenticated nor encrypted 1 - SRTP Only: Secure Calls are possible only and media is always authenticated and encrypted 2 - Best-Effort SRTP: Secure and InSecure Calls are possible Media is authenticated and encrypted if the other party supports SRTP Otherwise media is not protected and RTP is used

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/MobileClient/mediaSecurityModeSbc
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the security mode used for voice media on Mobile Clients when connected through SBC to OSV Changes to the value are applied to the Mobile Client When the client (re)enters Wi-Fi or is turned off and back on Values: 0 - RTP Only: InSecure Calls are possible only and media is neither authenticated nor encrypted 1 - SRTP Only: Secure Calls are possible only and media is always authenticated and encrypted 2 - Best-Effort SRTP: Secure and InSecure Calls are possible Media is authenticated and encrypted if the other party supports SRTP Otherwise media is not protected and RTP is used

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/MobileClient/OSVCertificateCheck
RtpParameter.Description: Enables enhanced certificate checking for TLS connections to OSV. If the value is 0, the certificate received from OSV in the TLS handshake will only be checked for expiry. If the value is 1 or 2, there must be a root certificate available on the mobile device which can validate the certificate received from OSV. The difference between a value of 1 and 2 is that a 1 value will allow a fallback to 0 on validation failure. This is meant to be only a temporary setting to allow certificate verification before deployment to the enterprise.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/MobileClient/SBCCertificateCheck
RtpParameter.Description: Enables enhanced certificate checking for TLS connections to OSV via an SBC. If the value is 0, the certificate received from the SBC in the TLS handshake will only be checked for expiry. If the value is 1 or 2, there must be a root certificate available on the mobile device which can validate the certificate received from the SBC. The difference between a value of 1 and 2 is that a 1 value will allow a fallback to 0 on validation failure. This is meant to be only a temporary setting to allow certificate verification before deployment to the enterprise.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/MobileClient/OSMOMutualAuth
RtpParameter.Description: Determines whether a mobile client should be mtually authenticated. If this parameter is set to true, OSV will always issue a digest challenge to a mobile client and will provide an Authentication-Info response to the mobile client on REGISTER messages to allow the mobile client to authenticate OSV. On upgrades, this parameter is set to the value of the existing parameter Srx/Sip/AuthEnabled. It is always true for new installations.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/MobileClient/WifiVideoCodecPriorityList
RtpParameter.Description: Lists the allowed video codec names for the Mobile Client when connected to Wi-Fi. The parameter contains a comma-separated list of codec names in prioritized order with the first codec in the list having the highest priority. Changes to the value are applied to the Mobile Client when the client (re)enters Wi-Fi or is turned off and back on. The following codecs are supported: VP8 and H264

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/TraffMeas/Settings5MinRetPeriod
RtpParameter.Description: Default value for 5 minute retention period. After this period the OMM statistic files are erased.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/TraffMeas/Settings15MinRetPeriod
RtpParameter.Description: Default value for 15 minute retention period. After this period the OMM statistic files are erased.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/TraffMeas/Settings30MinRetPeriod
RtpParameter.Description: Default value for 30 minute retention period. After this period the OMM statistic files are erased.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/TraffMeas/SettingsHourlyRetPeriod
RtpParameter.Description: Default value for 60 minute retention period. After this period the OMM statistic files are erased.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/TraffMeas/SettingsDailyRetPeriod
RtpParameter.Description: Default value for daily retention period. After this period the OMM statistic files are erased.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/MaxCSTAConnections
RtpParameter.Description: Maximum number of active TCP connections to the hiPath8000 listening CSTA address. Note that any application may connect more than once which accounts for more than one connection.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/MaxMonitoredEndpoints
RtpParameter.Description: Maximum number of active MonitorStart requests accepted across all active connections to the hiPath8000. This maximum is checked against a sum of all active MonitorStart requests across all connections

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/ListenerPortNumber
RtpParameter.Description: Port that CSTA applications must use when connecting to the CSTA listening IP address. This is very rarely changed

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/GNFPrefixReplacement
RtpParameter.Description: Value that is prepended to a dialed number during a Makecall if the calledDirectoryNumber is in GNF format. For example if the hiQ/CSTA/GNFPrefixReplacement is set to "8011" and a MakeCall is sent from a CSTA application with calledDirectoryNumber as "+15619239999" the number passed to translation will be "801115619239999". It is the responsibilty of the administrator to setup translation to handle this number correctly. Parm is only used now for backward compatibility with V5.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/HTTPSoapListenerPort
RtpParameter.Description: Port that applications use when connecting to OpenScape Voice via CSTA over HTTP/SOAP. CSTA over HTTP/SOAP uses same IP address as CSTA over TCP.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/HTTPSoapSenderPort
RtpParameter.Description: Port that OpenScape Voice use when connecting to applications via CSTA over HTTP/SOAP. CSTA over HTTP/SOAP uses the IP address provided by the application on the HTTP/SOAP listener port

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/TelefonicaEBG
RtpParameter.Description: Enables or disables Telefonica EBG functionality that impacts CSTA interface over Soap connections

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/TelefonicaEID
RtpParameter.Description: Telefonica Enterprise Identification prefixed to subscriber deviceIDs.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/TelefonicaPASCODE
RtpParameter.Description: Telefonica Enterprise Identification prefixed to subscriber deviceIDs.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/TelefonicaNPIDName
RtpParameter.Description: Numbering plan name for Telefonica subscriber's. This is used by CSTA to get NPID and then convert subscriber extension to fully qualified number.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/TelefonicaBGName
RtpParameter.Description: Numbering plan name for Telefonica subscriber's. This is used by CSTA to get NPID and then convert subscriber extension to fully qualified number.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/TelefonicaAppID
RtpParameter.Description: Telefonica Application ID added to SOAP header.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/TelefonicaOutsideAccess
RtpParameter.Description: Outside access code for external number conversion.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/HeartbeatTimer
RtpParameter.Description: System Status Heartbeat timer interval value. This is how long the OSV waits for a response from the SOAP connected application. A value of 0 disables the heartbeat function.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/HeartbeatWatchDogTimer
RtpParameter.Description: System Status Heartbeat watchdog timer value. This is how long the OSV waits before retrying after a successful heartbeat transaction

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/HeartbeatRetry
RtpParameter.Description: System Status Heartbeat retry value. This is how many times OSV tries to make a successful heartbeat transaction before the SOAP connection is considered disconnected

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/MTLSListenerPort
RtpParameter.Description: Port that CSTA applications must use to securely connect to CSTA listener IP address. The default is rarely changed.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/OSMOVirtualDeskPhoneOption
RtpParameter.Description: Bool to indicate if OSMO enabled subsribers that do not have a registered Desk Phone on the OpenScape Voice system are allowed to use their Call Forward Dependable non-VoiceMail, non-Cell target as a Virtual Desk Phone for routing of inbound calls

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CSTA/ONSBypassCfDnd
RtpParameter.Description: FRN7613 - Bool to indicate if an offered event should be suppressed for an ONS subscriber. If an ONS subscriber has Call Forward - Unconditional variant or Do Not Disturb feature activated and if this parameter is enabled, an offered event is suppressed for a NON-MLHG call.

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CCL/MaxCallLogSize
RtpParameter.Description: Defines the maximum number of call log records per subscriber the Centralized Call Log internal service will store before overwriting older entries

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/CCL/TrackingCategory
RtpParameter.Description: Defines what subscriber category the Centralized Call Log internal service will track

RtpParameter.Name: hiQ/OCMR/OfferedEventFilter
RtpParameter.Description: Used by OCMR to determine if bulk monitor start request should filter the Offered events

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/Host
RtpParameter.Description: FQDN or IP of Primary Billing Server FTP link. Make sure the Billing Server has an FTP client and the user is setup with write permission to its home directory. The Billing Server link connection is terminated, refreshed and re-established when this option is modified from the OpenScape voice Assistant application.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/User
RtpParameter.Description: User name of the Primary Billing Server FTP link connection. Make sure the Billing Server has an FTP client and the user is setup with write permission to its home directory. The Billing Server link connection is terminated, refreshed and re-established when this option is modified from the OpenScape voice Assistant application.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/HostBackup
RtpParameter.Description: FQDN or IP of Backup Billing Server FTP link. Make sure the Billing Server has an FTP client and the user is setup with write permission to its home directory. The Billing Server link connection is terminated, refreshed and re-established when this option is modified from the OpenScape voice Assistant application.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/UserBackup
RtpParameter.Description: User name of the Backup Billing Server FTP link connection. Make sure the Billing Server has an FTP client and the user is setup with write permission to its home directory. The Billing Server link connection is terminated, refreshed and re-established when this option is modified from the OpenScape voice Assistant application.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/EncryptedPassword
RtpParameter.Description: Encrypted Password of the Primary Billing Server FTP link connection. Make sure the Billing Server has an FTP client and the user is setup with write permission to its home directory. The Billing Server link connection is terminated, refreshed and re-established when this option is modified from the OpenScape voice Assistant application.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/EncryptedBackupPassword
RtpParameter.Description: Encrypted Password of the Backup Billing Server FTP link connection. Make sure the Billing Server has an FTP client and the user is setup with write permission to its home directory. The Billing Server link connection is terminated, refreshed and re-established when this option is modified from the OpenScape voice Assistant application.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/Refresh
RtpParameter.Description: The value of this parameter is monitored for changes which causes all the CDR Handler parameters to be refreshed and the Billing Server FTP link connections to terminate and re-established. This parameter is incremented by the OpenScape voice Assistant application when applying CDR billing options modifications from the 'Configure CDR settings' window. If a parameter is changed via the Cli, the Refresh parameter has to be modified as well in order for the CDR Handler configure update takes place and the billing parameters get refreshed and reread again.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/FtpPort
RtpParameter.Description: The FTP port to connect to when PUSHing CDR billing files to the billing server. The Billing Server link connection is terminated, refreshed and re-established when this option is modified from the OpenScape voice Assistant application.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/SftpPort
RtpParameter.Description: The SFTP port to connect to when PUSHing CDR billing files to the billing server.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/SftpEnable
RtpParameter.Description: The field defines whether SFTP is enabled or not. If enabled, the SFTP port is used and not FTP's.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/Rename_Extension
RtpParameter.Description: The field defines whether the CDR billing files will have a differen file extension other than 'BF' after having been PUSHed successfully to the billing server. The Billing Server link connection is terminated, refreshed and re-established when this option is modified from the OpenScape voice Assistant application.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/Second_Storage
RtpParameter.Description: The field defines whether the CDR billing files are going to be saved as secondary data in a specific path on the hiPath server having been PUSHed successfully to the billing server. The Billing Server link connection is terminated, refreshed and re-established when this option is modified from the OpenScape voice Assistant application.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/AutoDelete
RtpParameter.Description: The field defines whether to delete the CDR billing files that are stored locally on the hiPath server in the /cdr directory that are older than the specified retention period. The Billing Server link connection is terminated, refreshed and re-established when this option is modified from the OpenScape voice Assistant application.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/Retention_Period
RtpParameter.Description: The number of retention days the CDR billing files will be kept on the hiPath before they are deleted. The Billing Server link connection is terminated, refreshed and re-established when this option is modified from the OpenScape voice Assistant application.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/Method
RtpParameter.Description: The field defines the desired CDR billing files delivery method, i.e. PUSH or PULL. The Billing Server link connection is terminated, refreshed and re-established when this option is modified from the OpenScape voice Assistant application.

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/HostClient
RtpParameter.Description: FQDN or IP of Primary Billing Client FTP link This is not used by CDRHandler but only for creating the PFRs

RtpParameter.Name: Srx/Usc/HostClientBackup
RtpParameter.Description: FQDN or IP of Backup Billing Client FTP link This is not used by CDRHandler but only for creating the PFRs
